page.title: 17LANDSCAPE
page.content: This are is situated in the southern edge of the{Antrim Plateau}and varies in height from 40-70m.Its surface was worn down during the{Ice Age}to form a gently undulating surface with small hills covered in thick deposits of boulder clay. About 90% of the land area is used for agriculture thus{buildings}are largely farmhouses with associated barns and sheds.Most farms are small and are scattered across the area. {Rural housing}has developed of late as town workers build bungalows to reside in the countryside. {Housing estates}occupy about 10% of the land area in the S.W.corner of the area.The houses are well arranged in rows with open space and local facilities provided.
